conclusion: Determine the work done by the external environment on the gas during the process from state C to state A.
Use the concept of work done in an ideal gas given by the formula W = âˆ« p dV.
State A: p_A = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_A = 2 L.
State B: p_B = 4 x 10^5 Pa, V_B = 5 L.
State C: p_C = 1 x 10^5 Pa, V_C = 0 L.
From C to B: The gas expands from state C to state B.
Change in volume dV is V_C - V_B = 0 - 5 = -5 L.
Change in pressure dp is p_C - p_B = 1 x 10^5 - 4 x 10^5 = -3 x 10^5 Pa.
Work done by the external environment W_C is W_C = dp x dV = (-3 x 10^5) x (-5) = 1.5 x 10^6 J.
From B to A: The gas contracts from state B to state A.
Change in volume dV is V_B - V_A = 5 - 2 = 3 L.
Change in pressure dp is p_B - p_A = 4 x 10^5 - 1 x 10^5 = 3 x 10^5 Pa.
Work done by the external environment W_B is W_B = dp x dV = (3 x 10^5) x 3 = 9 x 10^5 J.
From A to C: The gas expands from state A to state C.
Change in volume dV is V_A - V_C = 2 - 0 = 2 L.
Change in pressure dp is p_A - p_C = 1 x 10^5 - 1 x 10^5 = 0 Pa.
Work done by the external environment W_A is W_A = dp x dV = 0 x 2 = 0 J.
From C to A: The gas contracts from state C to state A.
Change in volume dV is V_C - V_A = 0 - 2 = -2 L.
